column3: I think these are included in #19183. Also, unless we added that check, I'm not sure if we want to modify nanobench.\n\nEdit: Saying that. #19183 is being split up/possibly blocked, so if the nanobench change is removed, I don't mind if this is merged earlier.

> I think these are included in #19183. Also, unless we added that check, I'm not sure if we want to modify nanobench.
> 
> Edit: Saying that. #19183 is being split up/possibly blocked, so if the nanobench change is removed, I don't mind if this is merged earlier.

Removed nanobench change, and added credits to @practicalswift.

I'm not sure this is correct, or at-least, now that this is only using `__has_builtin()` for the builtin checks, they wont be defined for GCC < 10, as that was the first version to get [`__has_builtin()`](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-10/changes.html).\n> New built-in functions: \n> The __has_builtin built-in preprocessor operator can be used to query support for built-in functions provided by GCC and

> I'm not sure this is correct, or at-least, now that this is only using `__has_builtin()` for the builtin checks, they wont be defined for GCC < 10, as that was the first version to get [`__has_builtin()`](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-10/changes.html).\n\nUpdated ([reverted back](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20491#discussion_r532107913)).
isn't this covered by the previous check already?\n\nhttps://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-7.1.0/gcc/Integer-Overflow-Builtins.html
